org.openbase.jul.storage.registry

Interface ConsistencyHandler<KEY,VALUE extends Identifiable<KEY>,MAP extends Map<KEY,VALUE>,R extends Registry<KEY,VALUE>>

  • Type Parameters:
    KEY - the registry key type.
    VALUE - the registry data value type.
    MAP -
    R -
    All Superinterfaces:
    Shutdownable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ProtoBufRegistryConsistencyHandler<KEY,M,MB>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractConsistencyHandler, AbstractProtoBufRegistryConsistencyHandler, AbstractTransformationFrameConsistencyHandler, AbstractVersionConsistencyHandler

    public interface ConsistencyHandler<KEY,VALUE extends Identifiable<KEY>,MAP extends Map<KEY,VALUE>,R extends Registry<KEY,VALUE>>
extends Shutdownable
    Author:
    Divine Threepwood ConsistencyHandler can be registered at any registry type and will be informed about data changes via the processData Method. The handler can be used to establish a registry data consistency.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.openbase.jul.iface.Shutdownable

        Shutdownable.ShutdownDeamon

    • Method Detail

      • processData

        void processData(KEY id,
                 VALUE entry,
                 MAP entryMap,
                 R registry)
          throws CouldNotPerformException,
                 EntryModification
        Method for establishing a registry data consistency. Method is called by the registry in case of entry changes.
        Parameters:
        id -
        entry -
        entryMap - the entry map of the underlying registry.
        registry - the underlying registry.
        Throws:
        CouldNotPerformException - thrown to handle errors.
        EntryModification - in case of entry modification during consistency process.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Method can be internally used to clear any temporally maps or other caches which are only used for one consistency check iteration. This method is called each time the registry consistency check starts a new iteration. In some cases it makes sense to cache any properties e.g. scopes or ids which should be globally unique. This check can be performed by caching these values within a map. To make sure these maps do not interfere between different consistency check iterations this method can be used to clear these kind of caches.
